{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Netgear |model=R6260 |series=AC1600 |asin=B07DHMFTXB |newegg=N82E16833122974 |price=110 |est_release_date=06/2018 |fcc_date=11/29/2017 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf=SerComm |type=wireless router |fcc_id=PY317300390 |ic_id=4054A-17300390 |pcb_id=CHJ00D-1.6 |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=1.5 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=MediaTek |cpu1_model=MT7621AT;MT7621AT, 1724-AMTH, CTPFAT98, DTPFAR85; |cpu1_cspeed=880 |cpu1_cores=2 |fla1=128 |fla1_brand=Macronix |fla1_model=MX30LF1G18AC-TI |ram1=128 |ram1_brand=Nanya |ram1_model=NT5CC64M16GP-DI |expansion_if_types=USB 2.0 |expansion_usb_num=1 |wi1_chip1_brand=MediaTek |wi1_chip1_model=MT7603E |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |wi2_chip1_brand=MediaTek |wi2_chip1_model=MT7615 |wi2_802dot11_protocols=an+ac |wi2_txchains=3 |wi2_rxchains=3 |wi2_sstreams=3 |eth_cpu=true |sw_cpu=true |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports=1 |802dot11_protocols=abgn+ac |default_user=admin |default_pass=password }}
:• '''1300''' Mbps - 3SS 5GHz [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_802.11ac#Data_rates_and_speed 802.11ac] (80MHz chan.), :• '''300''' Mbps - 2SS 2.4GHz [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_802.11n-2009#Data_rates 802.11n] (40MHz chan.) = '''''1600 Mbps'' class'''
{{TagLine|AC1600 Smart WiFi Router}} :{{ProductPage|https://www.netgear.com/home/products/networking/wifi-routers/R6260.aspx}} {{SupportPage|vendor=Netgear|model=R6260}} "CHJ00D-1.6" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos. {{See also|Netgear R6220|Netgear R6800|SerComm}} The radio chip IDs are not visible in the FCC internal photos :but MT7603E + MT7615? seems like a reasonable guess. The 5GHz chip appears to be wired for four spatial streams but :the fourth is not connected to any antenna and would likely be :disabled in software limiting this device to three spatial streams. The [[Netgear WAC124]] uses the same board but has all four spatial :streams implemented making it an AC2000 product. * Web GUI: http://www.routerlogin.net
